body:
Comment 3: 
You are right, annealing() uses quite a lot of random numbers since it implements a
monte-carlo algorithm. Using a different random number generator for every go-routine as
suggested improved runtime on linux and solved the problem on the mac mini. I can't test
things properly using the cluster since it's under heavy load atm, but the first tests
look very promising.

Thanks a lot.

PS.: I had the same problems some days ago on a 4-Core linux box using an old kernel
(2.6.24). I will have a look at the new numbers on that one too and report back soon.
